item.title: Awesome Games Done Quick 2026 raises over $2.44 million for charity
item.content:encoded:
Chris Kerr, Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

January 12, 2026

1 Min Read

Image via Awesome Games Done Quick

Awesome Games Done Quick 2026 (AGDQ) has raised over $2.44 million for the Prevent Cancer Foundation. 

The latest edition of the annual charity speedrunning marathon was held in Pittsburgh and ran from January 4 to January 10. 

Thousands of attendees supported the event in person, while others around the world watched along via 24-hour livestreams on Twitch and YouTube. 

The fundraiser sees a cohort of speedrunners race through a kaleidoscope of video games, which this year included Super Mario 64, Mario Kart World, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (played by French-styled cosplayers), American Truck Simulator, and Resident Evil 2 Remake (completed using a Guitar Hero controller). 

Each run is archived on the official Games Done Quick YouTube channel, which eclipsed 1 million subscribers following AGDQ 2026. 

Games Done Quick has raised almost $60 million for charities such as Doctors Without Borders, the Prevent Cancer Foundation, Malala Fund, and Organization for Autism Research since its inception in 2010.

Upcoming Games Done Quick events include Back to Black—the speedrunning event organized by the Black in a Flash community—and Summer Games Done Quick. Those events will return in February and July, respectively. 

About the Author

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

Game Developer news editor Chris Kerr is an award-winning reporter with over a decade of experience in the game industry. His byline has appeared in notable print and digital publications including Edge, Stuff, Wireframe, International Business Times, and PocketGamer.biz. Throughout his career, Chris has covered major industry events including GDC, PAX Australia, Gamescom, Paris Games Week, and Develop Brighton.
